Class EarthServerGenericClient.LODTerrain


Extends EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain.
This terrain builds up a LOD with 3 levels of the received data.
Defined in: Terrain.js.

Class Detail
EarthServerGenericClient.LODTerrain(root, data, index, noDataValue, noDemValue)
Parameters:
root
- Dom Element to append the terrain to.
data
- Received Data of the Server request.
index
- Index of the model that uses this terrain.
noDataValue
- Array with the RGB values to be considered as no data available and shall be drawn transparent.
noDemValue
- The single value in the DEM that should be considered as NODATA
Field Detail
canvasTexture
The canvas that holds the received image.
<inner> chunkInfo
General information about the number of chunks needed to build the terrain.
<inner> chunkSize
Size of one chunk. Chunks at the borders can be smaller. We want to build 3 chunks for the LOD with different resolution but the same size on the screen. With 121 values the length of the most detailed chunk is 120. The second chunk has 61 values and the length of 60. With a scale of 2 it's back to the size of 120. The third chunk has 31 values and the length if 30. With a scale of 4 it's also back to the size 120.
<inner> currentChunk
Counter for the insertion of chunks.
<inner> lodRange1
Distance to change between full and 1/2 resolution.
<inner> lodRange2
Distance to change between 1/2 and 1/4 resolution.
Method Detail
createTerrain()
Builds the terrain and appends it into the scene.
nextFrame()
The Scene Manager calls this function after a few frames since the last insertion of a chunk.
